title.narrative: NATIONAL CAPACITIES FOR KM AND REPORTING

description.narrative: Improved national and sub-national capacities to systematically collect, analyse and use disaggregated data and other forms of information to monitor, inform policy decisions, and report on the situation of children and child poverty in all of its dimensions, using an equity-based approach, which contributes to Climate Change, Disaster Risks And Envionmental Degradation, Cross Sectoral - Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices, Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses (Covid), Reducing Child Poverty, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, national systems and policies are effectively addressing multiple deprivations affecting the most vulnerable boys and girls across the lifecycle, and building their resilience, through adequately funded social investments and rights-based quality social policies based on adequately disaggregated data on children.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Improved national and sub-national capacities to systematically collect, analyse and use disaggregated data and other forms ofinformation to monitor, inform policy decisions, and report on the situation of children and child poverty in all of its dimensions, using an equity-based approach

description.narrative: UNICEF Jamaica was successful in establishing a partnership the Planning Institute of Jamaica and the Statistical institute of Jamaica to implement the Multiple Indicator Cluster Survey (MICS), with field work scheduled for early 2022. ;In addition, UNICEF leverage resources from the Interamerican Development Bank to support the completion of the survey.; Two studies were disseminated in 2021, namely The Effect of the COVID-19 Pandemic on Jamaican Children, and Climate Landscape Analysis for Children and Persons with Disabilities (CLAC). Preliminary results from the knowledge, attitude, practice, and behaviour (KAPB) baseline survey on family violence were disseminated to key stakeholders.; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:25/01/2022
